elements.name: McMaster University
bullet_points: Honours Computer Science Co-op (B.A.Sc.)

elements.name: Google
elements.title: Engineering Practicum Intern
bullet_points: Co-authored a technically detailed project design document to propose Charcoal: a Python gRPC service and a C++/Angular frontend for generating changelogs used for diagnosing failures in large continuous builds.
Developed and deployed Charcoal, and measured a 75% reduction in median changelog generation time over existing tools.
Created and deployed a Python command line tool wrapping the Charcoal RPC service to provide a backup in the event of frontend failures.

elements.name: Caliber Communications
elements.title: Jr. Software Developer
bullet_points: Worked independently to create the tools and applications that laid the groundwork for real-time object detection on hundreds on video streams in real time.
Developed a tool in Python for training and benchmarking neural networks defined in Tensorflow.
Created an Angular Web App for labelling objects in images and managing a large image dataset.
Wrote a REST API in Node.js to manage image datasets; and the training, storage, and benchmarks for neural network architectures.
Designed and implemented a horizontally scalable inference node that uses gRPC and a multiprocessing pipeline to handle inference requests.

extra_info.text: Tensorflow, Keras, Numpy, OpenCV, Express, Angular, PostgreSQL, gRPC

elements.name: Weever Apps
elements.title: QA Automation Developer
bullet_points: Worked with the QA manager to ensure the stability and functionality of Weever Apps' products.
Developed Bash scripts and SQL queries that reduced time to deploy native apps by over 80%.
Designed and developed an automated testing suite in JavaScript using Mocha and Selenium.

Stood in as QA manager in the absence of the regular manager, taking on the responsibilities of giving the final go-ahead on production code pushes, and working with developers and project managers to ensure deadlines were met.

elements.name: Cathedral High School
elements.title: Freelance Web Developer
bullet_points: Worked part-time with Cathedral's teacher-librarian to develop a web app to gamify the creation of MLA and APA style citations for use in a classroom setting.
Supports an admin panel which enables administrators to modify quiz content and allows teachers to view submissions from students in their class.

elements.name: McMaster Computer Science Society
elements.title: President
bullet_points: Ensures the integrity of the McMaster CS Society as an organization focused on the betterment of the Computer Science program and community at McMaster.
Oversees the organization of small scale academic and social events (20-30 people), as well as larger Industry events (100-200 people).
Served as the McMaster Computer Science Curriculum Committee Student Representative to help design a new curriculum to best fit the needs of undergraduate students in Computer Science.
Previously volunteered as Vice President Academic and First Year Representative.

elements.name: McMaster Engineering Representative
bullet_points: Volunteers as a Engineering Representative during Welcome Week and at outreach and community building events throughout the year.
Currently organizing a number of tech-focused events for the 2019 Welcome Week to help foster inclusion by diversifying the types of events available to incoming students.

elements.name: HamOnt JS
bullet_points: Gave a talk detailing my experience developing a JavaScript based automated testing suite for Weever Apps.
Discussed the merits of various frameworks and design patterns that can be used for automated testing in JavaScript.

elements.name: St. Patrick's Robotics Club
bullet_points: Volunteered at a local elementary school as a leader/mentor to an all-girls robotics team.
Helped give students an understanding of programming through hands-on problem solving with LEGO Robotics.

elements.name: Hacking Health Hamilton
bullet_points: Attended the two-day Hacking Health Hamilton conference and worked with a team to develop a prototype of our solution to medication regimen compliance issues: MedKit.
Won people's choice award for our prototype and presentation.

elements.name: CNN: Neural Networks in C
bullet_points: Developed a neural network library entirely from the ground up in C.
Implements feed forward neural networks as directed computational graphs of Tensors.
Supports higher order functionality similar to Keras, which allow training on custom datasets in only a few lines of code.

elements.name: Face Aging with Conditional Generative Adversarial Networks
bullet_points: Researched and implemented an algorithm proposed by Antipov et al. for artificial facial aging using an Age Conditional Generative Adversarial Network.
Worked with a group of 4 students to develop the training and inference infrastructure in GCP using Flask and Postgres.

elements.name: Proximity
bullet_points: Worked with a team of 3 at YHack to develop an application that helps reduce overcrowding on campus by enabling users to view how busy certain areas are.
Developed an Express REST API that collates the device info periodically gathered by the Raspberry Pis and provides anonymized activity data to the Angular frontend.

extra_info.text: Kali Linux, Aircrack-ng, Express, Angular, Postgres

elements.name: Personal Website
bullet_points: Created a personal website in Angular 6 for hosting my resume and other information.
Resume data is read from a JSON configuration file and rendered as a cleanly printable HTML page.
Hosted using Netlify with CI build and deployment triggered on master branch push/merge.

elements.name: Curtis Clicker
bullet_points: Developed a Computer Science themed "Cookie Clicker" web app for a course assignment.
Created in Elm: a functional language that compiles into HTML and JavaScript.
Uses Webpack to build into a static distributable.

elements.name: The Class Of '44 Scholarship
bullet_points: Awarded to the student who achieved the highest Fall-Winter Average of their program.

elements.name: Provost's Honour Roll
bullet_points: Awarded to students who achieve a perfect GPA over a full school year.

elements.name: The Pollock Family Academic Grant
bullet_points: Awarded to a student in the Faculty of Engineering who has completed Level 1, attained a high Fall-Winter Average and demonstrates financial need.

elements.name: Nikola Tesla Educational Corporation Scholarship
bullet_points: Awarded to a student who graduated from a high school in the City of Hamilton, has completed Level 1 Engineering with a high average, and who demonstrates a commitment to continuing in a field of study that is directly related to Nikola Teslaâ€™s work and body of knowledge.

elements.name: McMaster President's Award
bullet_points: Awarded to incoming students who have achieved admission averages of 95%+.
